com.example.mental.rpgo

Class DatabaseHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • SQLiteOpenHelper
      • com.example.mental.rpgo.DatabaseHelper

  • public class DatabaseHelper
extends SQLiteOpenHelper
    This class provides all the required functions and information about the database. Connection, setting and getting data from it

        newVersion - int: The desired version number of the database(Should be higger than the

      • getID

        public Cursor getID(java.lang.String name,
                    java.lang.String pwd,
                    java.lang.String email)
        Runs a query to the users table, trying to find a corresponding id for a given name, password and email
        Parameters:
        name - String: The given name to match the one at the database
        pwd - String: The given password to match the one at the database
        email - String: The given email to match the one at the database
        Returns:
        The Cursor instance of the query run inside the function

      • deleteKeys_loc

        public boolean deleteKeys_loc(int id)
        Deletes the column with the given id from keys_location table. If there is no match for the given id, returns false.
        Parameters:
        id - int: The Integer instance of the given id
        Returns:
        The Boolean instance of the query result. True if a result was found. Else false.

      • getKeys

        public int getKeys(java.lang.String id)
        Given a String instance of id, the functions tries to find the number of keys collected by the user up to this moment.
        Parameters:
        id - String: The String instance of the given id
        Returns:
        The Integer instance of the number of the keys found from the user up to this moment.

      • setKeys

        public void setKeys(java.lang.String id,
                    int value)
        Given a number of keys and an id, the function tries to update the number of the keys collected bu the user. Throws an Exception if the query fails.
        Parameters:
        id - String: The String instance of the given id
        value - int: The Integer instance of the given number of keys
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getTimestamp

        public double getTimestamp(java.lang.String id)
        Given an id, this function tries to find the time passes since the user's sign up
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        The Double instance of seconds passed since the user's sign up. 0 if the query fails.

      • getKeysTimestamp

        public double getKeysTimestamp(java.lang.String id)
        Given an id, this functions tries to find the time since the last update of the keys location.
        Parameters:
        id - String: The String instance of the given id
        Returns:
        The Double instance of time passed since the keys locations where last updated. Returrnes 0 if the query fails.

      • setKeysTimestamp

        public boolean setKeysTimestamp(double timeRemaining,
                                java.lang.String id)
        Given an id and a value, this function updates the time remaining for the keys location until they are re-arranged.
        Parameters:
        timeRemaining - double: The Double instance of the new time remaining of the key location
        id - String: The String instance of the given id
        Returns:
        The Boolean instance of the result of the query run. If the query fails, returns false and an Exception
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
        See Also:
        Exception

      • insert_user

        public boolean insert_user(java.lang.String name,
                           java.lang.String pwd,
                           java.lang.String newemail,
                           double keys_timestamp)
        Given all the information required, this functions tries to insert a new user into the database
        Parameters:
        name - String: The String instance of the new user's name
        pwd - String: The String instance of the new user's password
        newemail - String: The String instance of the new user's email
        keys_timestamp - double: The Double instance of the remaining time until the keys locations re-arrange
        Returns:
        The Boolean result of the query. False if the query failed.

        public boolean update_user(int nr,
                           int id)
        Updates the user's current riddle state
        Parameters:
        nr - int: The Integer instance of the next riddle to be solved by the user
        id - int: The Integer instance of the given id
        Returns:
        The Boolean instance of the result of the query. Returns false, if the quert fails.

      • check_duplicate

        public boolean check_duplicate(java.lang.String fieldName,
                               java.lang.String value)
        Given a field name and a value, this function checks if there is a duplicate insertion inside the users table
        Parameters:
        fieldName - String: The String instance of given field name
        value - String: The String instance of the given value
        Returns:
        The Boolean instance of the result of the query. Returns false if there is NOT a duplicate.
